Calculate Gene Conservation Scores

Source: R/calculate_conservation.R
calculate_conservation.Rd

This function calculates conservation scores for genes based on their Estimate values and the variability of these estimates across samples/batches. Genes with high estimate values and low variability are considered conserved, while genes with low estimates or high variability are considered non-conserved.

Usage

calculate_conservation(
  h5_file,
  metric = "Estimate",
  mean_weight = 0.5,
  variability_weight = 0.5,
  conservation_threshold = 0.6,
  normalize_scores = TRUE
)

Arguments

h5_file

Path to the HDF5 file containing model results

metric

Name of the metric to use for conservation calculation (default: "Estimate")

mean_weight

Weight for the mean component in the score calculation (default: 0.5)

variability_weight

Weight for the variability component in the score calculation (default: 0.5)

conservation_threshold

Threshold for classifying genes as conserved (default: 0.6)

normalize_scores

Whether to normalize scores to 0-1 range (default: TRUE)

Value

A data frame with gene names, conservation scores, classification, and metrics
